what's jquery-ujs?
what's the meaning of Unobtrusive JavaScript?

data.message: I am sure you must have googled it and found that http://blog.teamtreehouse.com/unobtrusive-javascript-important
The thing is that you keep your HTML clean, it won't be containing JavaScript allover the place.

Also, imagine if you are adding a specific action to an HTML tag, if you are using obtrusive js you will have to repeat the function and update it in all occurring instances. However if you are using unobtrusive js you will add the even to all tag with a specific tag and modify/upfate the function in on place.

Muhammad Negm It's mainly for maintainability and learning how to write a clean code. Let's say you have this example: W3C Article and you use many of it in all your application and you application grow and grow and this piece of code grow as well. imagine the headache of going throw all your code and adding a class like 'js-newwindow' and cleaning all your code and test it. so why not taking 5 min planning before you write this code and make it abstract and clean. - Donâ€™t repeat yourself (DRY) is a principle of software development: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don%27t_repeat_yourself Need more?
I understand this but, why there's 'jquery-ujs'
I assume you are using it in a Rails Project, Right?

Alright :) Let me explain to you:

jquery-ujs wires event handlers to eligible DOM elements to provide enhanced functionality. In most cases, the eligible DOM elements are identified by HTML5 data attributes.

So you must have seen something like this:
<%= form_for item, data: { confirm: 'Are you sure?' } %>

jquery-ujs attaches a handler to links or forms with the data-confirm attribute that displays a JavaScript confirmation dialog. The user can choose to proceed with or cancel the action.

This is a very good article explains how jquery-ujs: http://robots.thoughtbot.com/a-tour-of-rails-jquery-ujs
